intro: Ornithogalum monophyllum subsp. eckardtianum, commonly known as the Eckardt’s star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of star-shaped, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. The plant is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It has a fibrous root system and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different floral morphology compared to other subspecies of Ornithogalum monophyllum.
